APPROACH
‘‘individual
or
combinations
of
symptoms and signs have inadequate test charac
teristics to rule in or rule out the diagnosis of
pneumonia. Decision rules that use the presence
or absence of several symptoms and signs to mod
ify the probability of pneumonia are available, the
simplest of which requires the absence of any vital
sign abnormalities to exclude the diagnosis. If diag
nostic certainty is required in the management of a
patient with suspected pneumonia, then chest
radiography (gold standard) should be performed’’
JAMA 1997 278:17
